Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER REED.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews Roman Catholic Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, N.Y.  10007.

Council Member Reed moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Brewer moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 9, 2002 be adopted as printed.

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 010473 ZSX, a special permit shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 010471 ZMX which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment  by the Mayor of ROSE GILL HEARN as the Commissioner of the Department of Investigation

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 801 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of ROSE GILL HEARN as the Commissioner of the Department of Investigation to serve for an indefinite term.

Res. No. 48

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF ROSE GILL HEARN AS THE COMMISSIONER OF THE DEPARTMENT OF INVESTIGATION

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 31 and Section 801 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of ROSE GILL HEARN as the Commissioner of the Department of Investigation to serve for an indefinite term.
Items.MatterName: M 3 - Rose Gill Hearn, Appointment, Commissioner of Investigation

Items.Title: RESOLUTION APPROVING THE REAPPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF BRUCE A. GREEN AS A MEMBER OF THE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST BOARD.
Items.MatterName: M 28 - Bruce A. Green, Reappointment, Conflicts of Interest Board

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges nd Elections approving the reappointment
by the Mayor of JANE W. PARVER as a member of the Conflicts of Interest Board

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on January 30, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 2602 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the reappointment by the Mayor of JANE W. PARVER as a member of the Conflicts of Interest Board for a term which will expire on March 31, 2006.

Res. No. 50

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE REAPPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF JANE W. PARVER AS A MEMBER OF THE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST BOARD

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 2602 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the reappointment by the Mayor of JANE W. PARVER as a member of the Conflicts of Interest Board for a term which will expire on March 31, 2006.
Items.MatterName: M 29 - Jane Parver, Reappointment, Conflicts of Interest Board

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the reappointment by the Borough President of Staten Island of  JOHN MEROLO as a member of the City  Planning Commission


The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which referred to on January 30, 2002, respectfully,

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges ad Elections hereby approves the reappointment by the Staten Island Borough President of JOHN MEROLO as a member of the City Planning Commission, for the remainder of a term which will expire on June 30, 2006.

Res. No. 52

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE REAPPOINTMENT BY THE STATEN ISLAND BOROUGH PRESIDENT OF JOHN MEROLO AS A MEMBER OF THE CITY PLANNING COMMISSION

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 31 and Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the reappointment by the Staten Island Borough President of JOHN MEROLO, as a member of the City Planning Commission for the remainder of a term which will expire on June 30, 2006.
Items.MatterName: M 31 - John Merolo, City Planning Commission

Introduction and Reading of Bills
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct an oversight hearing on the temporary closing of the firehouse at 124 Liberty Street, which housed Engine Company 10 and Ladder Company 10, due to damage caused by the September 11th attack.
Items.MatterName: Closing of Firehouse at 124 Liberty Street

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member McLaughlin, A.2322, "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the annual fee for lessor filing of registration plate numbers with a parking violations bureau in cities of one million or more persons for each leased or rented vehicle owned by it".
Items.MatterName: Annual fee for lessor filing of registration plate numbers (A.2322)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Boyland and Greene, et al, A.3342, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health to publish notice of violations by establishments selling food".
Items.MatterName: Publish notice of violations by establishments selling food (A.3342)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Scarborough, Diaz, M. Cohen, Dinowitz, Stringer, Greene and Ortiz, et al, A.4924, "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to requiring school speed limits to be no more than twenty miles per hour in cities having a population in excess of one million".
Items.MatterName: Requiring school speed limits to be no more than twenty miles per hour (A.4924)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Straniere, A.4977, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating the official flag of the borough of Staten Island".
Items.MatterName: Designating the official flag of the borough of Staten Island (A.4977)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Straniere, A.6536, "AN ACT to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to sales tax on clothing and footwear in cities with a population of one million or more".
Items.MatterName: Sales tax on clothing and footwear (A.6536)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Straniere, A.7235, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring developers to post a bond to ensure compliance with any conditions of development".
Items.MatterName: Requiring developers to post a bond to ensure compliance with any conditions of development (A.7235).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Onorato, S.1172 and Assembly Members McLaughlin, Weisenberg and M. Cohen, A.652, "AN ACT to amend the general city law, in relation to authorizing certain cities to restrict the location of retail "adult materials" businesses".
Items.MatterName: Authorizing certain cities to restrict the location of retail "adult materials" businesses (S.1172, A.652).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.1762 and Assembly Members Lavelle and Vitaliano, A.6844, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to certification of architectural plans".

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.2335-A and Assembly Member Pheffer, et al, A.4225-A, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to establishing a procedure for medical review in correction member disability cases".
Items.MatterName: Establishing a procedure for medical review in correction member disability cases (S.2335-A, A.4225-A).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.805 and Assembly Member McLaughlin, A.2567, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to residence districts".
Resolution urging the establishment of a Commission on Queen Mother Moore Reparations for Descendants of Africans of New York City.
Items.MatterName: Establish a Commission on Queen Mother Moore Reparations

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to adding information on minority- and woman-owned business enterprises to the City’s contract database.
Items.MatterName: Minority and Woman-Owned Business Contract Database

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to damages for delay clauses in public contracts.
A Local Law to amend the Charter of the city of New York, in relation to any person appointed to a board or commission in New York City, being a resident of New York City.
A Local Law in relation to a street name, Steve Mercado Stickball Boulevard, Borough of The Bronx.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Steve Mercado Stickball Blvd, Bronx

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Amadou Diallo Place, Borough of The Bronx.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Amadou Diallo Place, Bronx

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the suspension of alternate side of the street parking rules on the religious holidays of Purim and Ash Wednesday.
Items.MatterName: Parking, Alternate Side Suspension Purim etc.

Items.Title: Resolution praising Rudolph Giuliani, "America's Mayor," as one of the greatest mayors in the history of the City of New York.

Resolution calling upon the Mayor to establish a new agency by executive order, or else designate an existing agency or division thereof, to coordinate the World Trade Center clean-up efforts in order to ensure that Lower Manhattan, and all surrounding areas affected by the toxic dust and debris caused by the September 11th tragedy, are made environmentally safe.
Items.MatterName: Establish a new agency, WTC Clean-up Efforts

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of language assistance services.

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing recourse for a property owner whose sidewalk is damaged by a tree under the exclusive care of the city of New York.
Items.MatterName: Recourse for an owner, sidewalk damaged by tree.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to increasing the fines for false self-certifications of housing code violations, to requiring that occupants are notified when a violation has been self-certified, and to extending the length of time in which the Department of Housing Preservation and Development may reinspect self-certified violations before such violations are "deemed corrected."

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to obligating the City to perform repairs upon sidewalks damaged by City-owned trees, fire hydrants, parking meters, emergency call boxes or other such public amenities.

Resolution calling upon the President of the United States to fulfill his promise of providing a total of $20 billion to New York City without delay due to the grievous budget deficits faced by New York City caused by the terrorists' attacks on the World Trade Center and urging both the United States Senate and House of Representatives to expeditiously fulfill this promise to the citizens and people of the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: President ot fulfill his promise of $20 Billion to NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate New York City agencies to coordinate a traffic safety plan in New York City that would identify intersections near senior citizen centers that are frequently used by senior citizens and require signs advising motorists to proceed cautiously.
Items.MatterName: Traffic Safety Plans, Senior Citizens Centers

Items.Title: Resolution observing and declaring February as Black History Month in the City of New York and recognizing the continuing contributions of the African-American community to the life of the City, State and Nation.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Declaring February as Black History Month.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to notice to borough presidents, council members and community boards regarding public hearings on acquisition or disposition of real property by the city.
A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to establishing an interagency coordinating council on health.
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring inspections of food service establishments.
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring quality based selection procurement for architectural and engineering services by city agencies.

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the appropriate State regulatory agencies to provide reduced energy rates for individuals living in the immediate vicinity of a power plant, and further calling upon the Mayor to propose a memorandum of understanding to be entered into between the City and those energy companies operating power plants within the City that would provide for reduced energy rates for such individuals.
Items.MatterName: Reduce rates for those living in vicinity of a power plant.

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. 010472 ZSX, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Bronx, Council District no. 13 to allow an enlargement without an increase in bed to an existing nursing home. By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 010472 ZSX, a special permit shall be subject to Council review. Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)
The presence of a quorum was announced by the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Rose Gill Hearn to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as Commissioner of Investigation, pursuant to Section 31 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Rose Gill Hearn, Appointment, Commissioner of Investigation

Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Approved, by Council

Items.Title: Communication from the Staten Island Borough President - Submitting the name of John Merolo to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the City Planning Commission, pursuant to Section 192 (a) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Approved, by Council

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 010303 PPK, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter concerning the disposition of two city-owned properties, located in Community Board 3, Borough of Brooklyn, Council Districts no. 34 and 36.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.

Zoning resolution amendment application no. 020037 ZRY, pursuant to §197-d and §200 f the New York City Charter, concerning changes in the text of the zoning resolution, Borough of Citywide, zoning text amendment to establish roadway and streetscape requirements for the use of private roads.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Miller) made the following announcements

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, February 27, 2002.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. 010471 ZMX, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter, concerning changes to the zoning map, Borough of Bronx, Council District no. 13.
Items.MatterName: ULURP,  Zoning Map Changes, CD#13, Bronx (20010471ZMX)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. 010472 ZSX, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Bronx, Council District no. 13 to allow an enlargement without an increase in bed to an existing nursing home.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.

Uniform land use review procedure application no. 010473 ZSX, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Bronx, Council District no. 13 to allow an enlargement of an existing nursing home.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.

Uniform land use review procedure application no. 020063 ZSM, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 1 to allow the modification of Section 91-31(a)(3)(Street Wall Regulations),Section 91-32(Setback Regulations), Section 91-33(Lot Coverage Regulations), Section 91-34(Maximum Horizontal dimensions for Tall Buildings) .  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.

Zoning resolution amendment application no. 020062 ZRM, pursuant to §197-d and §200 of the New York City Charter, concerning changes in the text of the zoning resolution, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 1, relating: to Section 91-30 (Height and Setback Regulations), to eliminating Section 91-311 (Modification of Streetwall Regulations and to establish Section 91-35 (Modification of Streetwall, Setback, Lot Coverage and Maximum Dimension Regulations) .

Uniform land use review procedure application no. 020064 ZSM, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 1 to allow an attended parking garage with a maximum of 200 spaces.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.

Uniform land use review procedure application no. 020065 ZSM, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 1 to allow Modification of  Section 37-04(d)(3) and Section 37-04(f)(1) Urban Plaza requirements.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
